result.eng: I saw her while looking out the window.

result.eng: [Looking at a family photo:] Let me see - six boys and four girls. Am I right?

result.eng: [Looking at a family photo:] That's Úna, that's Niamh. Then Muiris, he is in the middle. Then Fiona; and myself at the end.

result.eng: She was deeply hurt looking at the poor man.

result.eng: Mother started looking worried.

result.eng: He was looking at the door as if the devil himself could come in any minute.
result.ga: Bhí sé ag breathnú ar an doras amhail is go bhféadfadh an t-áibhirseoir féin teacht isteach nóiméad ar bith
result.orig: Bhí sé ag breathnú ar an doras amhail is go bhféadfadh an t-áibhirseoir féin teacht isteach nóiméad ar bith

result.ponchtml: Ḃí sé ag breaṫnú ar an doras aṁail is go ḃféadfaḋ an t-áiḃirseoir féin teaċt isteaċ nóiméad ar biṫHe was looking at the door as if the devil himself could come in any minute.

result.eng: It wasn't long before white people started looking at black people as a sub-race.
